poem:
Title: "The Unseen Battle of the Young"

Stage, set with anxiety's taut strings,
Pupils, sieged in the battlefield of minds.
In empty seats, a silent plea rings:
An echo of fear the stern system binds.
Change comes, not in form, but in kind,
In fields fertile for young thought to reap,
Where dread is tamed, and the fearful find
Their place, not ere the shadows seep.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "If pupils avoid school due to anxiety, the system needs to change | Letters Persistent absenteeism in schools has become an area of increasing concern in education (Nearly a third of UK secondary pupils avoid school due to anxiety, survey finds, 2 February). The response to that absenteeism is still focused on children and young people changing their attitudes and behaviour in order to fit in better into the educational system, with cognitive behaviour therapy". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
